beschrijving.en-x-generated:
In principle, any company can become a service voucher company provided it obtains accreditation. Commercial enterprises as well as NPOs and PCSWs can apply for accreditation. Your enterprise can either exclusively carry out service voucher activities or also carry out other activities besides service voucher activities.

To become a recognised enterprise, you must meet a series of conditions. For instance, you must participate in an information session, deposit a deposit of €25,000 and, according to the regulations on service vouchers, add a correct business plan. General conditions also apply.

After obtaining recognition, you can hire employees who want to work as service cheque employees. These may also be foreign employees, provided they have a valid work permit. These employees must also meet certain conditions. You are not allowed to hire certain categories of workers through a service voucher employment contract. They are also only allowed to perform a certain number of well-defined tasks.

Approving services performed and paying service voucher employees

Service voucher employees input the services they performed. The company and the customer validate the services performed so that the employees can be paid. The customer can opt for electronic or paper service vouchers. Electronic service vouchers clearly have advantages for both customers and your company.

Voorafgaand moet je door de Vlaamse Overheid erkend zijn als dienstencheque-onderneming. Vanaf dan heb je recht op een jaarlijks opleidingsbudget waarmee je de gedeeltelijke terugbetaling kan aanvragen van de kosten van een opleiding die past bij jouw dienstencheque-onderneming.

De opleiding voor dienstenchequewerknemers moet je ook laten erkennen. Dienstencheque-ondernemingen kunnen een erkenning aanvragen zowel voor opleidingen die ze zelf geven, als voor opleidingen van externe opleidingsverstrekkers. Een opleiding wordt enkel erkend als ze te maken heeft met de taken die dienstenchequewerknemers uitvoeren. De erkenning moet er zijn voor het begin van de opleiding.

Externe opleidingsverstrekkers moeten ook voldoen aan het kwaliteits-en registratiemodel van het beleidsdomein Werk en Sociale Economie.
beschrijving.en:
You must first be recognised as a service voucher company by the Flemish authorities. From then on, you are entitled to an annual training budget which allows you to apply for a partial refund of the costs of training that suits your company’s needs.

You should have the training for service voucher employees recognised as well. Service voucher companies can apply for recognition for training provided either by themselves or by external training providers. Training courses will only be recognised if they relate to the tasks performed by service voucher employees. Recognition must be in place before the start of the training.

External training providers must also comply with the quality and registration model of the Work and Social Economy policy area.

The mentor reduction (Dutch: mentorkorting) is a reduction in the contributions to the National Social Security Office (NSSO) for employers who organise workplace training, using one or more experienced employees as mentor or trainer. It concerns training for specific target groups of employees, e.g. trainees from full-time secondary education, young people with an apprenticeship contract or secondary school teachers doing a work placement.

By reducing the NSSO contributions, the authorities want to encourage employers to open up their companies or institutions to workplace training. In this way, they help reduce the unqualified outflow from education and offer young job seekers further training.

Werkgevers uit zowel de openbare als de privésector komen in aanmerking.

  • een of meer van zijn werknemers (de ‘mentoren’) belasten met de begeleiding van die stages of opleidingen.

The precise criteria to be met by the different categories of persons undergoing training and the mentors can be found on the website.

beschrijving.en:
Employers

Any employer in the private and public sector (including non-profit organisations) who hires an employee at a place of business in the Flemish Region is eligible for the subsidy.

Employers of companies in difficulty are not eligible.

Employees

The employee must at the same time:

  • have been registered with VDAB as a non-working job seeker for at least 2 years upon entry into employment. Periods of short employment (less than three months), incapacity for work or imprisonment may be equated with periods as a job seeker.
  • be aged 25 or older and under 56 at the end of the quarter of entry into employment,
  • be granted an employment contract of indefinite duration, or equivalent (temporary employment contracts of at least 3 months are also eligible, if they are customary in the company's recruitment policy).
  • be working at a place of business in the Flemish Region
  • have an employment contract that took effect no earlier than 1 January 2017.

Not eligible: employees with a:

  • temporary employment contract
  • contract as a flexi-job employee
  • contract as a casual employee

The recruitment incentive cannot be combined with:

  • the salary incentive in the context of supported employment (sheltered and social workshops)
  • the remuneration in the context of local service economy
  • the salary incentive in the context of insertion companies (Dutch: invoegbedrijven).

Payment

The employer receives the recruitment incentive in two instalments:

  • a first instalment of maximum EUR 1,250, when the employee has worked for the company for three months
  • a second instalment of maximum EUR 3,000, when the employee has worked for the company for one year.

Part-time employment

  • If the employee works less than 30%, no subsidy will be granted.
  • If the employee works between 30% and 80%, the subsidy will be 60% of the maximum (EUR 750 for the first instalment and EUR 1,800 for the second).
  • If the employee works more than 80%, the employer will receive the maximum subsidy.

The first subsidies have been paid since 10 October 2017.

Dat is een aanvullende uitkering, boven op de onderbrekingsuitkering die u krijgt van de Rijksdienst voor Arbeidsvoorziening (RVA).

beschrijving.nl-BE-x-formal:
Privésector

In de privésector kunt u in 3 gevallen een aanmoedigingspremie krijgen, namelijk als u kiest voor:

  • zorgkrediet (tijdskrediet of thematisch verlof om voor kinderen of hulpbehoevenden te zorgen)
  • opleidingskrediet
  • krediet in het kader van een onderneming in moeilijkheden of herstructurering.

Socialprofitsector

In de socialprofitsector kunt u in 5 gevallen een aanmoedigingspremie krijgen, namelijk als u kiest voor:

  • zorgkrediet (thematisch verlof om voor kinderen of hulpbehoevenden te zorgen)
  • opleidingskrediet
  • landingsbaan
  • loopbaankrediet (als u uw loopbaan voltijds onderbreekt)
  • krediet in het kader van een onderneming in moeilijkheden of in herstructurering.

Om in aanmerking te komen voor een aanmoedigingspremie, moet u altijd:

  • al een goedkeuring van een onderbrekingsuitkering van de RVA gekregen hebben voor uw thematisch verlof of tijdskrediet.
  • 12 maanden aaneensluitend een arbeidscontract gehad hebben voordat uw tijdskrediet of thematisch verlof ingaat.

Lees meer over de verschillende aanmoedigingspremies.
